race.name: Fairy
race.ability: Increase one ability score by 2, and increase a different one by 1, or increase three different scores by 1

trait.name: Fairy Magic
trait.text: You know the druidcraft cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the faerie fire spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the enlarge/reduce spell with this trait. Once you cast faerie fire or enlarge/reduce with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 13

trait.name: Flight
trait.text: Because of your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor.
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 13

trait.name: Language
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for the character
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 12

race.name: Harengon
race.ability: Increase one ability score by 2, and increase a different one by 1, or increase three different scores by 1

trait.name: Hare-Trigger
trait.text: You can add your proficiency bonus to your initiative rolls.
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 13

trait.name: Leporine Sense
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 13

trait.name: Lucky Footwork
trait.text: When you fail a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your reaction to roll a d4 and add it to the save, potentially turning the failure into a success. You can't use this reaction if you're prone or your speed is 0.
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 13

trait.name: Rabbit Hop
trait.text: As a bonus action, you can jump a number of feet equal to five times your proficiency bonus, without provoking opportunity attacks. You can use this trait only if your speed greater than 0. You can use it a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 13

trait.name: Language
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for the character
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 13

trait.name: Skill Proficiencies
trait.text: Deception, Survival
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 10

trait.name: Tool Proficiencies
trait.text: One type of musical instrument
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 10

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: One of your choice of Elvish, Gnomish, Goblin, or Sylvan
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 10

trait.name: Equipment
trait.text: A musical instrument (one of your choice), a set of traveler's clothes, three trinkets (each determined by rolling on the Feywild Trinkets table), and pouch contained 8 gp.
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 10

trait.name: Fey Mark
trait.text: You were transformed in some small way by your stay in the Feywild and gained a fey mark, determined by rolling on the Fey Mark table.
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 10

trait.name: Feywild Visitor
trait.text: Whenever you're sound asleep or in a deep trance during a long rest, a spirit of the Feywild might pay you a visit, if the DM wishes it. Determine the spirit's form by rolling on the Feywild Visitor table. No harm ever comes to you as a result of such visits, which can last for minutes or hours, and you remember each visit when you wake up. Conversations that occur with a visitor can contain any number of things, from messages and insights to nonsense and red herrings, at the DM's discretion. Such conversations are always conducted in a language you can understand, even if the Feywild visitor can't speak that language normally.
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 10

trait.name: Feature: Feywild Connection
trait.text: Your mannerisms and knowledge of fey customers are recognized by natives of the Feywild, who see you as one of their own. Because of this, friendly Fey creatures are inclined to come to your aid if you are lost of need help in the Feywild.
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 11

trait.name: Skill Proficiencies
trait.text: Performance, Sleight of Hand
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 11

trait.name: Tool Proficiencies
trait.text: Disguise kit or one type of musical instrument
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 11

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: One of your choice
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 11

trait.name: Equipment
trait.text: A diguise kit or a musical instrument of your choice, a deck of cards, a carnival uniform or costume, one trinket (determined by rolling on the Feywild Trinkets table), and a pouch containing 8 gp.
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 11

trait.name: Carnival Companion
trait.text: Over the years, you have earned the friendship of another carnival fixture. Roll a d8 and consult the Carnival Companion table to determine whom or what you've befriended, or you can choose an option that you like. Work with your DM to flesh out this friendship. This companion hangs around you while you're in the carnival, but it won't voluntarily leave the carnival.

The DM can use the Witchlight hand stat block in chapter 1 to represent hands, performers, and animal trainers who serve as carnival companions. Statistics for the other companions appear in the Monster Manual.
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 11

trait.name: Feature: Carnival Fixture
trait.text: The Witchlight Carnival provides you with free, modest lodging and food. In addition, you may wander about the carnival and partake in its many wonders at no cost to you, provided you don't distrupt its shows or cause any other trouble.
Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight: pg. 11
